{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is at 42 weeks of gestation, which is considered a post-term pregnancy. Post-term pregnancies are associated with an increased risk of meconium aspiration. This is because fetal gastrointestinal motility increases with advancing gestational age, leading to passage of meconium into the amniotic fluid. During labor or shortly before delivery, the fetus can aspirate this meconium-stained amniotic fluid, leading to meconium aspiration syndrome. The other options listed are not specifically associated with post-term pregnancies.", "answer_choice": "C. Meconium aspiration"}
